hints.label: thm-quantitative-propagation-chaos
hints.title: Quantitative Propagation of Chaos (Target)
hints.content:
63: :label: thm-quantitative-propagation-chaos
64: 
65: Let $\nu_N^{QSD}$ be the quasi-stationary distribution of the N-particle system and let $\rho_0$ be the mean-field invariant measure. For any Lipschitz observable $\phi: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}$ with constant $L_\phi$, we have:
66: 
67: $$
68: \left| \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \phi(z_i) \right] - \int_\Omega \phi(z) \rho_0(z) dz \right| \leq C_{\text{obs}} \cdot \frac{L_\phi}{\sqrt{N}}
69: $$

hints.label: lem-wasserstein-entropy
hints.title: Wasserstein-Entropy Inequality
hints.content:
85: :label: lem-wasserstein-entropy
86: 
87: Under the N-uniform LSI ({prf:ref}`thm-n-uniform-lsi`), the 2-Wasserstein distance between $\nu_N^{QSD}$ and $\rho_0^{\otimes N}$ satisfies:
88: 
89: $$
90: W_2^2(\nu_N^{QSD}, \rho_0^{\otimes N}) \leq \frac{2}{\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} \cdot D_{KL}(\nu_N^{QSD} \| \rho_0^{\otimes N})
91: $$

hints.label: lem-quantitative-kl-bound
hints.title: Quantitative KL Bound
hints.content:
113: :label: lem-quantitative-kl-bound
114: 
115: Let $\mathcal{H}_N(t) := D_{KL}(\mu_N(t) \| \rho_0^{\otimes N})$ be the relative entropy at time $t$. Under the cloning mechanism with rate $\lambda$ and the N-uniform LSI, we have:
116: 
117: $$
118: \mathcal{H}_N(t) \leq \mathcal{H}_N(0) \cdot e^{-\lambda_{\text{eff}} t} + \frac{C_{\text{int}}}{N}
119: $$
120: 
121: where $\lambda_{\text{eff}} = \min(\lambda, \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} \kappa_W \delta^2)$ and $C_{\text{int}}$ is the interaction complexity constant.

hints.label: lem-lipschitz-observable-error
hints.title: Empirical Measure Observable Error
hints.content:
142: :label: lem-lipschitz-observable-error
143: 
144: For any Lipschitz observable $\phi: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}$ with constant $L_\phi$, the expected Wasserstein distance between the empirical measure and the target measure controls the observable error:
145: 
146: $$
147: \left| \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \phi(z_i) \right] - \int_\Omega \phi(z) \rho_0(z) dz \right| \leq L_\phi \cdot \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ W_1(\bar{\mu}_N, \rho_0) \right]
148: $$
149: 
150: where $\bar{\mu}_N = \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N \delta_{z_i}$ is the empirical measure.
151: 
152: The proof proceeds in two steps:

139: **Key Lemma** (to prove):

141: :::{prf:lemma} Empirical Measure Observable Error
142: :label: lem-lipschitz-observable-error
143: 
144: For any Lipschitz observable $\phi: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}$ with constant $L_\phi$, the expected Wasserstein distance between the empirical measure and the target measure controls the observable error:
145: 
146: $$
147: \left| \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \phi(z_i) \right] - \int_\Omega \phi(z) \rho_0(z) dz \right| \leq L_\phi \cdot \mathbb{E}_{\nu_N^{QSD}} \left[ W_1(\bar{\mu}_N, \rho_0) \right]
148: $$
149: 
150: where $\bar{\mu}_N = \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N \delta_{z_i}$ is the empirical measure.
151: 
152: The proof proceeds in two steps:
153: 1. Use Kantorovich-Rubinstein duality: $\left| \int \phi d\bar{\mu}_N - \int \phi d\rho_0 \right| \leq L_\phi \cdot W_1(\bar{\mu}_N, \rho_0)$
